node.title: Missing tennis star Peng Shuai says she 'wants her privacy respected' in video call with IOC president
node.alt: IOC President Thomas Bach talks to Peng Shuai on a video call.
node.description: After concerns for her safety following her sexual assault allegation against a former Communist Party official, the International Olympic Committee says Ms Peng has told its president that she is "safe and well".
node.content: ["The International Olympic Committee says Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai has called\u00a0its president to\u00a0tell him she is safe and well.", "The video call\u00a0appears to be Ms Peng's first direct contact with sports officials outside China since she disappeared from public view on November\u00a02 after raising an allegation of sexual assault against a former senior Chinese government official.", "In a statement, the IOC said that at the start of the 30-minute call with its president Thomas Bach, Ms Peng thanked the IOC for its concern about her wellbeing.", "\"That is why she prefers to spend her time with friends and family right now.", "\"Nevertheless, she will continue to be involved in tennis, the sport she loves so much,\" it said.", "Top tennis players including Serena Williams, Novak Djokovic, Rafal Nadal and Roger Federer have all voiced their concern for Ms Peng's welfare since her apparent disappearance.", "More to come."]
